name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Thurman MEARION, Appellant

parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Thurman MEARION, Appellant.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM

attorneys: A. Charles Peruto, Jr., Philadelphia, for appellant.
Gaele McLaughlin Barthold, Deputy Dist. Atty., Ronald Eisenberg, Chief, Appeals Div., Marianne Cox, Philadelphia, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
516 A.2d 1384
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. Thurman MEARION, Appellant.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued Oct. 23, 1986.
Decided Nov. 12, 1986.
A. Charles Peruto, Jr., Philadelphia, for appellant.
Gaele McLaughlin Barthold, Deputy Dist. Atty., Ronald Eisenberg, Chief, Appeals Div., Marianne Cox, Philadelphia, for appellee.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, HUTCHINSON, ZAPPALA and PAPADAKOS, JJ.
